DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Substance Abuse Prescription Illicit Substance Over the Counter Product Personal Medical History Yes No Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator that asks whether there is maladaptive use of prescription drugs (substances obtained only by the order of legal medical professional), illegal drugs (substances deemed as harmful and usually subject to legal restriction), or over-the-counter drugs (medicine that can be bought without a prescription), that may lead to social, occupational, psychological, or physical problems as part of a person's medical background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual as part of the Drug Abuse Screening Test (DAST-10), an assessment tool for the systematic examination of the maladaptive use of prescription drugs (substances obtained only by the order of a legal medical professional), illegal drugs (substances deemed as harmful and usually subject to legal restriction), or over-the-counter drugs (medicine that can be bought without a prescription), that may lead to social, occupational, psychological, or physical problems for the individual.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Substance Abuse Prescription Illicit Substance Over the Counter Product Concurrent Use Personal Medical History Yes No Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator that asks whether there was maladaptive use of multiple prescription drugs (substances obtained only by the order of legal medical professional), illegal drugs (substances deemed as harmful and usually subject to legal restriction), or over-the-counter drugs (medicine that can be bought without a prescription), at the same time, that may lead to social, occupational, psychological, or physical problems, as part of a person's medical background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual as part of the Drug Abuse Screening Test (DAST-10), an assessment tool for the systematic examination of the maladaptive use of prescription drugs (substances obtained only by the order of a legal medical professional), illegal drugs (substances deemed as harmful and usually subject to legal restriction), or over-the-counter drugs (medicine that can be bought without a prescription), that may lead to social, occupational, psychological, or physical problems for the individual.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Substance Abuse Prescription Illicit Substance Over the Counter Product Cessation Ability Personal Medical History Yes No Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator that asks whether a person has the ability to stop the maladaptive use of prescription drugs (substances obtained only by the order of legal medical professional), illegal drugs (substances deemed as harmful and usually subject to legal restriction), or over-the-counter drugs (medicine that can be bought without a prescription), that may lead to social, occupational, psychological, or physical problems as part of a person's medical background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual as part of the Drug Abuse Screening Test (DAST-10), an assessment tool for the systematic examination of the maladaptive use of prescription drugs (substances obtained only by the order of a legal medical professional), illegal drugs (substances deemed as harmful and usually subject to legal restriction), or over-the-counter drugs (medicine that can be bought without a prescription), that may lead to social, occupational, psychological, or physical problems for the individual.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Substance Abuse Prescription Illicit Substance Over the Counter Product Blackout Flashbacks Personal Medical History Yes No Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator that asks whether there was impairment of short-term and/or long-term memory (occurring during episodes of substance abuse where consciousness is retained, or due to the presence of spontaneous recurrence of visual hallucinations or other effects of a drug such as LSD, long after the use of the drug has been discontinued), as a result of the maladaptive use of prescription drugs (substances obtained only by the order of legal medical professional), illegal drugs (substances deemed as harmful and usually subject to legal restriction), or over-the-counter drugs (medicine that can be bought without a prescription), that may lead to social, occupational, psychological, or physical problems as part of a person's medical background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual as part of the Drug Abuse Screening Test (DAST-10), an assessment tool for the systematic examination of the maladaptive use of prescription drugs (substances obtained only by the order of a legal medical professional), illegal drugs (substances deemed as harmful and usually subject to legal restriction), or over-the-counter drugs (medicine that can be bought without a prescription), that may lead to social, occupational, psychological, or physical problems for the individual.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Substance Abuse Prescription Illicit Substance Over the Counter Product Guilt Regret Personal Medical History Yes No Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator that asks whether a person has had a feeling of shame and sorrow based on the belief of having done something wrong or failing an obligation, or a feeling of disappointment or distress about something that one wishes could be different, as a result of the maladaptive use of prescription drugs (substances obtained only by the order of legal medical professional), illegal drugs (substances deemed as harmful and usually subject to legal restriction), or over-the-counter drugs (medicine that can be bought without a prescription), that may lead to social, occupational, psychological, or physical problems as part of a person's medical background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual as part of the Drug Abuse Screening Test (DAST-10), an assessment tool for the systematic examination of the maladaptive use of prescription drugs (substances obtained only by the order of a legal medical professional), illegal drugs (substances deemed as harmful and usually subject to legal restriction), or over-the-counter drugs (medicine that can be bought without a prescription), that may lead to social, occupational, psychological, or physical problems for the individual.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Substance Abuse Prescription Illicit Substance Over the Counter Product Domestic Partnership Spouse Complain Personal Medical History Yes No Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator that asks whether a person's spouse or domestic partner has expressed feelings of pain, dissatisfaction, or resentment as a result of that person's maladaptive use of prescription drugs (substances obtained only by the order of legal medical professional), illegal drugs (substances deemed as harmful and usually subject to legal restriction), or over-the-counter drugs (medicine that can be bought without a prescription), that may lead to social, occupational, psychological, or physical problems as part of a person's medical background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual as part of the Drug Abuse Screening Test (DAST-10), an assessment tool for the systematic examination of the maladaptive use of prescription drugs (substances obtained only by the order of a legal medical professional), illegal drugs (substances deemed as harmful and usually subject to legal restriction), or over-the-counter drugs (medicine that can be bought without a prescription), that may lead to social, occupational, psychological, or physical problems for the individual.
DataElementQueryResults.changeNote: Possible CDE for reuse

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Substance Abuse Prescription Illicit Substance Over the Counter Product Family Neglect Personal Medical History Yes No Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator that asks whether a person has had episodes of paying little or no attention to, or otherwise disregarding the needs of her/her family, as a result of the maladaptive use of prescription drugs (substances obtained only by the order of legal medical professional), illegal drugs (substances deemed as harmful and usually subject to legal restriction), or over-the-counter drugs (medicine that can be bought without a prescription), that may lead to social, occupational, psychological, or physical problems as part of a person's medical background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual as part of the Drug Abuse Screening Test (DAST-10), an assessment tool for the systematic examination of the maladaptive use of prescription drugs (substances obtained only by the order of a legal medical professional), illegal drugs (substances deemed as harmful and usually subject to legal restriction), or over-the-counter drugs (medicine that can be bought without a prescription), that may lead to social, occupational, psychological, or physical problems for the individual.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Substance Abuse Prescription Illicit Substance Over the Counter Product Crime Obtain Personal Medical History Yes No Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator that asks whether a person has engaged in acts that are punishable by law in order to obtain and maladaptively use prescription drugs (substances obtained only by the order of legal medical professional), illegal drugs (substances deemed as harmful and usually subject to legal restriction), or over-the-counter drugs (medicine that can be bought without a prescription), that may lead to social, occupational, psychological, or physical problems as part of a person's medical background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual as part of the Drug Abuse Screening Test (DAST-10), an assessment tool for the systematic examination of the maladaptive use of prescription drugs (substances obtained only by the order of a legal medical professional), illegal drugs (substances deemed as harmful and usually subject to legal restriction), or over-the-counter drugs (medicine that can be bought without a prescription), that may lead to social, occupational, psychological, or physical problems for the individual.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Substance Abuse Prescription Illicit Substance Over the Counter Product Substance Withdrawal Syndrome Personal Medical History Yes No Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator that asks whether a person has experienced a substance-specific organic brain syndrome relating to the discontinuation of administration or use or reduction in intake of an addictive substance, as a result of the maladaptive use of prescription drugs (substances obtained only by the order of legal medical professional), illegal drugs (substances deemed as harmful and usually subject to legal restriction), or over-the-counter drugs (medicine that can be bought without a prescription), that may lead to social, occupational, psychological, or physical problems as part of a person's medical background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual as part of the Drug Abuse Screening Test (DAST-10), an assessment tool for the systematic examination of the maladaptive use of prescription drugs (substances obtained only by the order of a legal medical professional), illegal drugs (substances deemed as harmful and usually subject to legal restriction), or over-the-counter drugs (medicine that can be bought without a prescription), that may lead to social, occupational, psychological, or physical problems for the individual.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Substance Abuse Prescription Illicit Substance Over the Counter Product Associated Disease or Disorder Personal Medical History Yes No Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator that asks whether there has been any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person, that is associated with the maladaptive use of prescription drugs (substances obtained only by the order of legal medical professional), illegal drugs (substances deemed as harmful and usually subject to legal restriction), or over-the-counter drugs (medicine that can be bought without a prescription), that may lead to social, occupational, psychological, or physical problems as part of a person's medical background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual as part of the Drug Abuse Screening Test (DAST-10), an assessment tool for the systematic examination of the maladaptive use of prescription drugs (substances obtained only by the order of a legal medical professional), illegal drugs (substances deemed as harmful and usually subject to legal restriction), or over-the-counter drugs (medicine that can be bought without a prescription), that may lead to social, occupational, psychological, or physical problems for the individual.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Substance Abuse Prescription Illicit Substance Over the Counter Product Screening Test Score
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the scoring system or value (0-10) for the Drug Abuse Screening Test (DAST-10), an assessment tool for the systematic examination of the maladaptive use of prescription drugs (substances obtained only by the order of a legal medical professional), illegal drugs (substances deemed as harmful and usually subject to legal restriction), or over-the-counter drugs (medicine that can be bought without a prescription), that may lead to social, occupational, psychological, or physical problems for the individual.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Substance Abuse Prescription Illicit Substance Past Year Personal Medical History Count
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the numeric count during the last 365 days of the instances of maladaptive use of prescription drugs (substances obtained only by the order of legal medical professional) or illegal drugs (substances deemed as harmful and usually subject to legal restriction), that may lead to social, occupational, psychological, or physical problems, as part of a person's medical background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual as part of the single-question screening test for drug use.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Substance Abuse Substance-Related Disorder Current Therapy Personal Medical History Yes No Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator that asks whether the participant is currently in treatment for substance abuse as part of a person's medical background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Substance Abuse Substance-Related Disorder Prior Therapy Personal Medical History Yes No Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator that asks whether the participant has ever been in treatment for drug/alcohol abuse as part of a person's medical background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Substance Abuse Illicit Substance Intravenous Route of Administration Personal Medical History Yes No Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator that asks whether the participant has ever used any drug by injection that may lead to social, occupational, psychological, or physical problems as part of a person's medical background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Substance Abuse Illicit Substance Marijuana Personal Medical History Frequency
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the frequency of usage of the illicit substance marijuana that may lead to social, occupational, psychological, or physical problems as part of a person's medical background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Substance Abuse Illicit Substance Cocaine Personal Medical History Frequency
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the frequency of usage of the illicit substance cocaine that may lead to social, occupational, psychological, or physical problems as part of a person's medical background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Substance Abuse Illicit Substance Opioid Personal Medical History Frequency
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the frequency of usage of the illicit substances opioids that may lead to social, occupational, psychological, or physical problems as part of a person's medical background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Substance Abuse Illicit Substance Stimulant Personal Medical History Frequency
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the frequency of usage of the illicit substances stimulants that may lead to social, occupational, psychological, or physical problems as part of a person's medical background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Substance Abuse Illicit Substance Sedative Personal Medical History Frequency
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the frequency of usage of the illicit substances sedatives that may lead to social, occupational, psychological, or physical problems as part of a person's medical background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Substance Abuse Illicit Substance Other Substance of Abuse Personal Medical History Frequency
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the frequency of usage of an other substance of abuse that may lead to social, occupational, psychological, or physical problems as part of a person's medical background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Substance Abuse Illicit Substance Other Substance of Abuse Personal Medical History Specify
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the free text field to specify the other illicit substance of abuse used that may lead to social, occupational, psychological, or physical problems as part of a person's medical background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual.
DataElementQueryResults.changeNote: Added Alt Question text

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Substance Abuse Illicit Substance Intravenous Route of Administration Personal Medical History Frequency
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the frequency of usage of a drug by injection that may lead to social, occupational, psychological, or physical problems as part of a person's medical background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Substance Abuse Prescription Illicit Substance Past Year Self-Administered Evaluation Method Personal Medical History Count
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the numeric count during the last 365 days of the instances of maladaptive use of prescription drugs (substances obtained only by the order of legal medical professional) or illegal drugs (substances deemed as harmful and usually subject to legal restriction), derived via a self-administered evaluation, that may lead to social, occupational, psychological, or physical problems, as part of a person's medical background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual as part of the single-question screening test for drug use.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Substance Abuse Illicit Substance Route of Administration Assessment Type
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the method of delivery or route of administration for a substance of abuse.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Timeline Followback Method Assessment Date
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the date a Timeline Followback Method assessment, a calendar-based measure for assessing self-reported retrospective daily estimates of alcohol, tobacco and/or illicit substance use, was performed.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Timeline Followback Method Illicit Substance Cannabinoids Marijuana Assessment Yes No Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator that asks whether the participant had used cannabinoids or marijuana, which includes pot, weed, grass, hash, and synthetic cannabinoids (e.g., K2, Spice) as part of the Timeline Followback Method assessment, a calendar-based measure for assessing self-reported retrospective daily estimates of alcohol, tobacco and/or illicit substance use.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Timeline Followback Method Illicit Substance Cocaine Assessment Yes No Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator that asks whether the participant had used cocaine as part of the Timeline Followback Method assessment, a calendar-based measure for assessing self-reported retrospective daily estimates of alcohol, tobacco and/or illicit substance use.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Timeline Followback Method Illicit Substance Crack Cocaine Assessment Yes No Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator that asks whether the participant had used crack cocaine as part of the Timeline Followback Method assessment, a calendar-based measure for assessing self-reported retrospective daily estimates of alcohol, tobacco and/or illicit substance use.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Timeline Followback Method Illicit Substance Amphetamine Stimulant Assessment Yes No Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator that asks whether the participant had used amphetamine-type stimulants, which includes methamphetamine (speed, crystal meth, ice), misuse of prescription stimulant medications, such as methylphenidate (Ritalin, Concerta), dextroamphetamine (Dexedrine), mixed amphetamine salts (Adderall), and diet pills as part of the Timeline Followback Method assessment, a calendar-based measure for assessing self-reported retrospective daily estimates of alcohol, tobacco and/or illicit substance use.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Timeline Followback Method Illicit Substance Opioid Methadone Assessment Yes No Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator that asks whether the participant had used opioid analgesics (including methadone), and misused prescription pain medications, such as oxycodone (OxyContin, Percocet), hydrocodone (Vicodin), morphine, Dilaudid, fentanyl, and buprenorphine (Suboxone, Subutex) as part of the Timeline Followback Method assessment, a calendar-based measure for assessing self-reported retrospective daily estimates of alcohol, tobacco and/or illicit substance use.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Timeline Followback Method Illicit Substance Heroin Assessment Yes No Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator that asks whether the participant had used heroin as part of the Timeline Followback Method assessment, a calendar-based measure for assessing self-reported retrospective daily estimates of alcohol, tobacco and/or illicit substance use.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Timeline Followback Method Illicit Substance Hallucinogens MDMA/Ecstasy Assessment Yes No Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator that asks whether the participant had used hallucinogens, including MDMA/ecstasy, LSD, acid, mushrooms, phencyclidine (PCP), rohypnol and Special K as part of the Timeline Followback Method assessment, a calendar-based measure for assessing self-reported retrospective daily estimates of alcohol, tobacco and/or illicit substance use.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Timeline Followback Method Illicit Substance Sedative and Hypnotics Negation Benzodiazepines Assessment Yes No Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator that asks whether the participant had used sedatives and hypnotics, excluding benzodiazepines. This includes barbiturates, such as Nembutal, Pentobarbital, Seconal, Secobarbital, Butalbital, Amytal, Butisol, Phenobarbital, and Tuinal, as well as Methaqualone, Sopor, Quaalude and Chloral Hydrate as part of the Timeline Followback Method assessment, a calendar-based measure for assessing self-reported retrospective daily estimates of alcohol, tobacco and/or illicit substance use.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Timeline Followback Method Illicit Substance Benzodiazepines Assessment Yes No Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator that asks whether the participant had used benzodiazepines, which includes misuse of anxiety medications, such as diazepam (Valium), lorazepam (Ativan), clonazepam (Klonopin), chlordiazepoxide (Librium), oxazepam (Serepax), and alprazolam (Xanax) as part of the Timeline Followback Method assessment, a calendar-based measure for assessing self-reported retrospective daily estimates of alcohol, tobacco and/or illicit substance use.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Timeline Followback Method Illicit Substance Inhalants Assessment Yes No Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator that asks whether the participant had used inhalants, including glue, gasoline, nitrous oxide, and paint thinner as part of the Timeline Followback Method assessment, a calendar-based measure for assessing self-reported retrospective daily estimates of alcohol, tobacco and/or illicit substance use.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Timeline Followback Method Illicit Substance Other Substance of Abuse Assessment Yes No Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator that asks whether the participant had used another substance of abuse; this includes misuse of over-the-counter (OTC) medicines, such as dextromethorphan, triple Cs, caffeine, bath salts, and anabolic steroids as part of the Timeline Followback Method assessment, a calendar-based measure for assessing self-reported retrospective daily estimates of alcohol, tobacco and/or illicit substance use.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Timeline Followback Method Illicit Substance Other Substance of Abuse Assessment Specify
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the free text field to specify the other substance of abuse the participant had used as part of the Timeline Followback Method assessment, a calendar-based measure for assessing self-reported retrospective daily estimates of alcohol, tobacco and/or illicit substance use.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Patient Past Year Alcohol Consumption Frequency
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: An interval or number reporting the estimated occurrence rate for how often beverages containing alcohol (by fermented or distillation) were consumed by an individual during the most recent preceding calendar year.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Patient Alcohol Consumption Past Year Difficulty Controlling Cessation Frequency
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The semi-quantitative description for rate of occurrence of an event for perceived loss of control or inability to self-regulate or stop initiated behavior regarding the drinking of beverages or other liquids containing ethanol or other alcohols in the past calendar year as reported by a person receiving medical care or treatment.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Patient Alcohol Consumption Past Year Failure Performing Responsibility Frequency
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The semi-quantitative description for rate of occurrence of an event for failure to perform or complete expected duties or obligations because of the drinking of beverages or other liquids containing ethanol or other alcohols in the past calendar year as reported by a person receiving medical care or treatment.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Patient Alcohol Consumption Past Year Morning Drink Frequency
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The semi-quantitative description for rate of occurrence of an event for a perceived need or craving at a time the past calendar year to consume a drink containing alcohol when waking in the morning after a prior day drinking beverages or other liquids containing ethanol or other alcohols as reported by a person receiving medical care or treatment.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Patient Alcohol Consumption Past Year Guilt Frequency
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The semi-quantitative description for rate of occurrence of an event with feelings of remorse, shame or sorrow following occurrences of drinking of beverages or other liquids containing ethanol or other alcohols in the past calendar year as reported by a person receiving medical care or treatment.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Patient Alcohol Consumption Past Year Amnesia Episode Frequency
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The semi-quantitative description for rate of occurrence of a distinct event where a loss of memory caused by organic and/or psychological factors is experienced following an occurrence of drinking beverages or other liquids containing ethanol or other alcohols in the past calendar year as reported by a person receiving medical care or treatment.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Patient Alcohol Consumption Related Injury Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The determination of whether or not an incident has taken place where damage to the self or another individual is inflicted on the body as a direct or indirect result connected with behavior involving the drinking of beverages or other liquids containing ethanol or other alcohols as reported by a person receiving medical care or treatment.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Patient Alcohol Consumption Behavior Concern Recommendation Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The determination of whether or not an incident has taken place where interest was expressed or advice was given by a medical health professional or any individual to reduce or modify existing activity connected with the drinking of beverages or other liquids containing ethanol or other alcohols as reported by a person receiving medical care or treatment.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Patient Alcohol Consumption Alcohol Use Disorders Identification Test Total Score
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The calculated value or added sum resulting from semi-quantitative responses from 10 questions on the validated instrument named the Alcohol Use Disorders Identification Test (AUDIT, either self or interviewer administered) to assess potential risks, including substance dependence, from behavior of an individual related to consumption of liquids containing ethanol or other alcohols.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Antibody Human Immunodeficiency Virus Test Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the yes/no/refused/don't know response reporting the result related to the human immunodeficiency virus antibody test, following measures described in the PhenX (consensus measures for Phenotypes and eXposures) Toolkit.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Antibody Human Immunodeficiency Virus Test Self-Report Status
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: information about the result of a human immunodeficiency virus antibody test as reported by an individual patient's subjective interpretation, not from documentation by a medical professional.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Human Immunodeficiency Virus Most Recent Test Interval
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: a period of time separating the calendar date in the present and another occurrence nearest before the present for a procedure to determine the presence of human immunodeficiency virus, a species of lentivirus, acknowledged to be the agent responsible for the acute infectious manifestations and immunologic abnormalities linked to the Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome.
DataElementQueryResults.changeNote: Created this CDE for content from PhenX Self-report of HIV Testing

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Adolescent Tobacco Smoking History Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A yes/no condition reported to record whether criteria are satisfied about puffing and/or inhaling smoke from a lit cigarette, cigar, or pipe that contains dried cured leaves of the tobacco plant by a juvenile between the onset of puberty and maturity.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Cigarette Smoking Lifetime Use Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A yes/no condition reported to record whether criteria are satisfied about puffing and/or inhaling smoke from a lit cigarette that contains dried cured leaves of the tobacco plant from the perspective of quantified use over the individual's lifetime.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Cigarette Smoking Lifetime Daily Use Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A yes/no condition reported to record whether criteria are satisfied about inhaling smoke from tobacco in the form of a cigarette that is done each day from the perspective of quantified use causing risk over the individual's lifetime.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Tobacco Use Adolescent Smoking Past Month Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: the yes/no response to a question about use of dried leaves of the tobacco plant in the form of puffing and/or inhaling smoke from a lit cigarette, cigar, or pipe by a juvenile between the onset of puberty and maturity that has occurred within the most recent 4 weeks or 30 calendar days before the present time.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Tobacco Daily Begin Age Value
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity provided by the respondent to describe the individual's age (in calendar years) at time when inhaling of smoke from tobacco products started to habitually occur on each day.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Tobacco Habit Begin Age Value
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity provided by the respondent to describe the individual's age (in calendar years) at time when inhaling of smoke from tobacco products started to occur as a pattern of repeated behavior requiring little conscious thought.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: PROMIS Adult Short Form 8a Pain Interference v1.0 PAININ9 1 Past 7 Days How Much Did Pain Interfere with Day to Day Activity Score 5 Point Scale
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation of how much in the past 7 days pain interfered with day to day activities, using a five-point Likert scale.
DataElementQueryResults.changeNote: 1/12/15 Changed attributes to meet PRO/HRQOL requirements for CRF R6 data standards. mc

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: PROMIS Adult Short Form 8a Pain Interference v1.0 PAININ22 2 Past 7 Days How Much Did Pain Interfere with Work Around the Home Score 5 Point Scale
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation of how much in the past 7 days pain interfered with work around the home, using a five-point Likert scale.
DataElementQueryResults.changeNote: 1/12/15 Changed attributes to meet PRO/HRQOL requirements for CRF R6 data standards. mc

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: PROMIS Adult Short Form 8a Pain Interference v1.0 PAININ31 3 Past 7 Days How Much Did Pain Interfere with Ability to Participate in Social Activities Score 5 Point Scale
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation of how much in the past 7 days pain interfered with their ability to participate in social activities, using a five-point Likert scale.
DataElementQueryResults.changeNote: 1/12/15 Changed attributes to meet PRO/HRQOL requirements for CRF R6 data standards. mc

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: PROMIS Adult Short Form 8a Pain Interference v1.0 PAININ3 7 Past 7 Days How Much Did Pain Interfere with Enjoyment of Life Score 5 Point Scale
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation of how much in the past 7 days pain interfered with enjoyment of life, using a five-point Likert scale.
DataElementQueryResults.changeNote: 1/12/15 Changed attributes to meet PRO/HRQOL requirements for CRF R6 data standards. mc

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: PROMIS Adult Short Form 8a Pain Interference v1.0 PAININ12 5 Past 7 Days How Much Did Pain Interfere with Things Usually Done for Fun Score 5 Point Scale
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation of how much in the past 7 days pain interfered with things usually done for fun, using a five-point Likert scale.
DataElementQueryResults.changeNote: 1/12/15 Changed attributes to meet PRO/HRQOL requirements for CRF R6 data standards. mc

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: PROMIS Adult Short Form 8a Pain Interference v1.0 PAININ36 6 Past 7 Days How Much Did Pain Interfere with Enjoyment of Social Activities Score 5 Point Scale
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation of how much in the past 7 days pain interfered with enjoyment of social activities, using a five-point Likert scale.
DataElementQueryResults.changeNote: 1/12/15 Changed attributes to meet PRO/HRQOL requirements for CRF R6 data standards. mc

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: PROMIS Adult Short Form 8a Pain Interference v1.0 PAININ34 4 Past 7 Days How Much Did Pain Interfere with Household Chores Score 5 Point Scale
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation of how much in the past 7 days pain interfered with household chores, using a five-point Likert scale.
DataElementQueryResults.changeNote: 1/12/15 Changed attributes to meet PRO/HRQOL requirements for CRF R6 data standards. mc

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: PROMIS Adult Short Form 8a Pain Interference v1.0 PAININ13 8 Past 7 Days How Much Did Pain Interfere with Family Life Score 5 Point Scale
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation of how much in the past 7 days pain interfered with family life, using a five-point Likert scale.
DataElementQueryResults.changeNote: 1/12/15 Changed attributes to meet PRO/HRQOL requirements for CRF R6 data standards. mc

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: PROMIS Adult Short Form 6b Pain Interference v1.0 PAININ8 Past 7 Days How Much Did Pain Interfere with Ability to Concentrate Score 5 Point Scale
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation of how much in the past 7 days pain interfered with their ability to concentrate, using a five-point Likert scale.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: TAPS Tool - Interviewer Version Past Year Frequency Any Tobacco Use TAPS Time Frequency 5 Point Scale
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: An instrument designed to screen and assess adult primary care patients for tobacco, alcohol, prescription drug, and drug use and problems related to their use._A period of time consisting of the 12 months before the present._A question about how often an individual uses or used any tobacco product._An ordered reference standard related to the use of tobacco, alcohol, or prescription medication within a period of time.
DataElementQueryResults.origin: TAPS Tool:TAPS Tool - Interviewer Version 1.0. Robert P. Schwartz, Li-Tzy Wu, Jennifer McNeely. 2016
DataElementQueryResults.changeNote: Created to coincide with publication of validation per request by D.Blumberg. mc 1/21/16 Correction to modify Value Domain PV to (change Once or Twice to Less than Monthly) to match validated instrument dataset per request by D. DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation of how often in the past year they had 4 or more drinks in one day (for females), a level of consumption indicating heavy drinking, using a 5 point Likert scale.
DataElementQueryResults.origin: TAPS Tool:TAPS Tool - Interviewer Version 1.0. Robert P. Schwartz, Li-Tzy Wu, Jennifer McNeely. 2016
DataElementQueryResults.changeNote: Created to coincide with publication of validation per request by D.Blumberg. mc 1/21/16 Preferred Question Text modified to match validated Instrument tool, including time period,  per request by D.Blumberg. pjw 10/7/16

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: TAPS Tool - Interviewer Version 1.0 Past Year How Often Use Medication For the Feeling To Get High More Often or in Larger Doses than Prescribed 5 Point Scale
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation of how often in the past year they used medications, from identified opiate pain relievers, sedatives, stimulants or sleeping medications, just for the feeling, to get high, or more often or in larger doses than prescribed, using a 5 point Likert scale.
DataElementQueryResults.origin: TAPS Tool:TAPS Tool - Interviewer Version 1.0. Robert P. Schwartz, Li-Tzy Wu, Jennifer McNeely. 2016
DataElementQueryResults.changeNote: Created to coincide with publication of validation per request by D.Blumberg. mc 1/21/16 Preferred Question Text modified to match validated Instrument tool, including time period,  per request by D.Blumberg. pjw 10/7/16

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: TAPS Tool - Interviewer Version 1.0 Past Year How Often Use Any Illegal Drugs 5 Point Scale
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation of how often in the past year they used illegal drugs including marijuana, cocaine or crack, heroin, methamphetamine, hallucinogens, ecstasy/MDMA, using a 5 point Likert scale.
DataElementQueryResults.origin: TAPS Tool:TAPS Tool - Interviewer Version 1.0. Robert P. Schwartz, Li-Tzy Wu, Jennifer McNeely. 2016
DataElementQueryResults.changeNote: Created to coincide with publication of validation per request by D.Blumberg. mc 1/21/16 Preferred Question Text modified to match validated Instrument tool, including time period,  per request by D.Blumberg. pjw 10/7/16

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Alcohol Lifetime History Yes No Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A yes/no response to a question that asks whether the person has consumed at least 1 drink of any kind of alcoholic beverage in their lifetime.
DataElementQueryResults.changeNote: Question text specific to PhenX Protocol Alcohol - Lifetime Use
